poem:
### Ecological Coloring Book

In the hushed corridors of Cop29,  
where whispers of change float,  
a gas company offers hues—  
soft, innocent crayons for little hands.  
Children color earth in greens and blues;  
beneath, a fossil fuel promise brews—  
quiet contradictions resting  
between the lines of innocence.  
A playful rainbow  
conjured by fingertips unaware.
